Reviews.Content: I was looking for a comfortable, clean hotel in the Napa Valley for a long week-end getaway. Everything that I looked at online was $300+. My husband and I decided to spend our money on food, wine, massages and mudbaths, rather than a fancy hotel. When I read all the good reviews of the Stevenson Manor Inn, I decided to go for it. And it was a great surprise. While it lacked the charm of many Napa hotels and B&B's, the room was spacious and incredibly comfortable. The Inn is owned by the same people who own the EuroSpan and Inn (where I might stay next time), and when we checked in, we were told we could go to the EuroSpa for a wine tasting, which we did. We then signed up for massages at their spa. The Inn is located on a quiet spot, just out of town. We took a gorgeous run from the Inn, across the Silverado Trail, and looped around some back roads passing amazing houses and vineyards. All in all I give it a good recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big rooms, clean, good service, very quiet”
Reviews.Author: KevinElls
Reviews.Content: Nice clean large room. Good service, great location. Walk to town for great everything. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Quiet and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TBJJBT
Reviews.Content: The stay here was the most pleasant surprise of our annual trip to Napa (have stayed in Napa and at resorts in the valley previously). Both room and bath were spacious and comfortable. The staff was attentive; breakfast was plentiful. Definitely the best value going.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Valley Find”
Reviews.Author: sacandaga3
Reviews.Content: This is a small facility that has been well cared for. Our room and bath were large, clean and attractively furnished. The grounds are lovely, and the continental breakfast ample. The staff was most accommodating and professional. Rates are reasonable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We got a GREAT deal!”
Reviews.Author: Arewethereyet7
Reviews.Content: After LOTS of searching and reading the other reviews at Trip Advisor for this hotel, we selected this Best Western and stayed two nights. I think the price on the room increased 75% the day we left. Really. For the area, we got an astounding value by staying in late March. The room was large, clean and nicely furnished. Nice touches included a coffee maker which was also a coffee grinder; wine glasses (small ones, but still...) and a wine-bottle opener. Bags of whole-bean coffee were provided with the coffee maker. The hotel is close to a major roadway, but traffic is light during the night; much heavier during the day. The pool/spa was right outside our window, but very few people used it and they were quiet. Standard continental breakfast fare was adequate; staff attentive and very friendly/helpful. Notebook with full menus from many restaurants easily available at the front desk. Comfortable bed, standard motel firm but there was some sort of mattess topper which softened it. We slept comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: ARBOP
Reviews.Content: My fiance stayed at the Stevenson Manor on a recent trip to Calistoga. This is our second time in town and the first at this hotel. We had a first floor room with a jacuzzi. The room was larger than expected and has a nice kitchenette. As previously mentioned, the towels are a little coarse but otherwise the bathroom is nice and large as well. I would recommend this location for those looking to stay in a nice, comfortable hotel without spending a fortune. We are having our wedding in Calistoga in June and I'm happy to say that the majority of our guests will be staying at this nice, clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SugrMag66
Reviews.Content: This hotel really surprised me. I chose it because it was the only place I could find in Calistoga that didn't have a 2 night minimum on the weekend, but I would stay there again regardless. It was super clean, and the staff was friendly and helpful. They have a nice outdoor heated pool and hot tub and an excellent free continental breakfast that included cereals, bagels, juices, and fresh fruit. I got a room on the second floor and I had my own private balcony. My room was huge and the bathroom was spotless. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Stevenson Manor”
Reviews.Author: trojans#1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel last thursday night and was very impressed with the service and the room. Very friendly and curtious staff and the room was very clean and good size. The water pressure was very good in the shower and it is very quiet place where you can sleep in piece. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: schnauzerlvr
Reviews.Content: My husband & I visited the Napa Valley area for 2 nights and stayed at the Stevenson Manor Inn. The room was large, clean and a good location. There was a nice coffee maker and coffee beans/grinder in the room for fresh coffee if desired. This was a nice touch. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. The housekeeping staff seemed to do a good job. The only slightly negative was that I felt that the mattress was hard and feel it's time to replace. Also, would suggest to the owner to purchase new towels. The current towels felt like sandpaper! I'm usually not "picky", but this couldn't be ignored. For the area, the Stevenson Manor Inn was a good deal and we enjoyed our stay. Oh, the courtyard is very nice with arbor and tables. Taking a meal back to the motel and eating in the courtyard is very restful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: seadawg
Reviews.Content: I was so worried about staying at another 'Best Western' hotel since a few days before we'd stayed at the Best Western Horizon Inn in Medford, OR that was not nice at all. I'd even called AAA to see what I could do if this hotel was bad since the town books up in the summer and you need to plan ahead. After AAA reassured me that this Best Western would probably be a good one, we arrived and it was one of the nicest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. It was super clean, beautifully situated, quiet and the pool was really lovely. The breakfast was one of the best I've seen a hotel offer and I can highly recommend them to anyone. Book ahead though, it's not a big hotel and they have few rooms with double queens. Also during the busy time of year, it's a 2 night minimum unless you luck out (as we did) and get a room 'in between' two bookings. Everyone that works there is really nice and the price is right -- keep in mind that Calistoga has become a destination for wine tours, etc, so the price for the room is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RixiePicklesticks
Reviews.Content: We played it safe and stuck with a chain hotel for our stay in Calistoga. The stay wasn't anything splendid and exciting, but there was nothing to complain about, which is how I like my hotel visits. The room was clean, didn't stink. The A/C worked and we could adjust the temperature to our liking. The shower had warm water, it had a typical bathtub for soaking. Bed was kinda hard (I like my beds really soft though - my boyfriend thought it was comfortable). The continental breakfast was actually pretty decent as far as continental breakfasts go. The pool, hot tub, and steam room were as you would expect. I liked the steam room though (just had to give it a bit to get itself warmed up - may want to turn it on the sit in the hot tub for 5 or 10 minutes so it can get all steamy). The people who worked there were very nice the few times we interacted with them - helped us out with directions and such. The location was good - we managed to walk to all the restaurants we ate at. It was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Stevenson Manor”
Reviews.Author: TheFinkles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I very much enjoyed our romantic get away at the Stevenson Manor. The staff was very knowledgable about the area and also very friendly. Our room was clean and cozy. Their complimentary breakfast was also very good. The pool was heated and there was a nice jacuzzi where we relaxed. I would reccomend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Scootergirl99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just a few minutes walk from the centre of Calistoga. The room was huge, very clean & overall it was really good value. There was a lovely heated swimming pool & jacuzzi - perfect after a hard day wine tasting !!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Affordable place to stay in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Dianica
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Stevenson Manor Inn and recommend it to all my friends considering a stay in Calistoga. I went for a 3 day vacation with my Mom, and we arrived to find a large, lovely clean room complete with a gas fireplace and a small kitchenette area. The staff was very nice, though my only complaints were that check-in was painfully slow that day, and the pool and hot tub closed at 10 pm. For the price and close proximity to my favorite day spa there however (Indian Springs), it was perfect. I recommend trying all the amazing restaurants in town, and spending at least one full day at the spa, and one full day at a winery like Mondavi. I will definitely stay there every time I visit Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Average chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonnevoyage
Reviews.Content: If you're looking online, you have the resources to find a better place than this at the same price - start looking through tripadvisor's listings. We didn't the first time, which is why we stayed here. It was exactly as expected - average chain hotel with outside pool and spa. Way too corporate for a stay in this cute little town. Even if you have kids, I think you could find a more interesting hotel/BnB with an outside pool. Having kids would be the only reason I would ever stay here again, and then as a last resort. Make your stay in Calistoga more special by spending your money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, new, comfortable place to stay in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip that included a night at the Stevenson Manor Inn. What a treat. We stayed mid-week and called to get a room price. They like to keep the Inn as full as possible so gave us a very good rate and put us in a huge room with a beautiful fireplace. Coffee makers with coffee grinders built in and fresh coffee beans ready to go. Clean, new and quiet and in a great location for visiting the various wineries in the Nappa Valley. Staff was wonderful, polite and seemed to enjoy making their customers happy. Nice continental breakfast to start your day. While in the area don't miss the tour of the Rutherford Winery caves. Interesting and fun. The deli food at V. Satillo Vineyards is amazing and we had a wonderful picnic on the grounds with a delicious bottle of their wine. If you're a "foody" don't miss attending a class at the Culinary Institute of America at Greystone. Chef was fun and informative and the focaccia was delicious. Their gourmet shop has everything you could hope for in the way of gadgets for the at home chef. Will return at the first opportunity to this lovely valley and will hope to stay at the Stephenson Manor Inn. Bonnie and Darrel
